column1: hybridshadowz 139622378537 "2016-02-19 22:12:20 GMT" https://hybridshadowz.tumblr.com/post/139622378537/the-un-sent-3-foreign-women-to-the-us-to-assess "savvymavvy: upslapmeal:  stfuprolifers:  The United States continues to embarrass.  The delegates were appalled by the lack of gender equality in America. They found the U.S. to be lagging far behind international human rights standards in a number of areas
column2: including its 23 percent gender pay gap
column4: affordable child care and the treatment of female migrants in detention centers. The most telling moment of the trip
column5: the women told reporters on Friday
column6: was when they visited an abortion clinic in Alabama and experienced the hostile political climate around womenâ€™s reproductive rights.  â€œWe were harassed. There were two vigilante men waiting to insult us
column8: the delegate from the U.K. The men repeatedly shouted
column9: â€œYouâ€™re murdering children!â€ at them as soon as they neared the clinic
column10: even though Raday said they are clearly past childbearing age.  â€œItâ€™s a kind of terrorism
column12: the delegate from Poland. â€œTo us
column13: it was shocking.â€ In most European countries
column15: abortions are performed at general doctorsâ€™ offices and hospitals that offer all kinds of other health services
column16: so there arenâ€™t protesters waiting to heckle the women who enter. The women discovered during their visit that women in the United States have â€œmissing rightsâ€ compared to the rest of the world. For instance
column17: the U.S. is one of three countries in the world that does not guarantee women paid maternity leave. The U.N. suggests that countries guarantee at least 14 weeks of paid parental leave. Some countries go further â€“ Iceland requires five months paid leave for each parent
column18: and an additional two months to be shared between them.  â€œThe lack of accommodation in the workplace to womenâ€™s pregnancy
column19: birth and post-natal needs is shocking
column20: â€ Raday said. â€œUnthinkable in any society
column21: and certainly one of the richest societies in the world.â€  Another main area of concern for the delegation is violence against women â€“ particularly gun violence. Women are 11 times more likely to be killed by a gun in the United States than in other high-income countries
column22: and most of those murdersare perpetrated by an intimate partner. While the Obama administration has talked a lot about combatting violence against women
column23: its efforts have been frustrated by Congressâ€™ inability to pass new federal gun restrictions.   While the delegates were shocked by many things they saw in the U.S.
column24: perhaps the biggest surprise of their trip
column26: was learning that women in the country donâ€™t seem to know what theyâ€™re missing. â€œSo many people really believe that U.S. women are way better off with respect to rights than any woman in the world
column27: â€ Raday said. â€œThey would say
column28: â€˜Prove it! What do you mean other people have paid maternity leave?â€™â€  The US is so far behind in womenâ€™s rights
